text:
Lata Mangeshkar has teamed up with R.D. Burman for many songs.

On legendary composer R.D. Burman’s 22nd death anniversary on Monday, melody queen Lata Mangeshkar paid tributes to him and said that his “music will continue to spread magic”.

Ms. Mangeshkar, who teamed up with Burman for songs like ‘Dilbar dil se pyare’, ‘Koi ladki koi ladka’, ‘Aaja piya tohe pyar doon’, ‘Mere naina sawan bhadon’ and ‘Tujhse naraz nahin zindagi’ among others, posted her message on Twitter.

She said the music and memories of Burman, who was lovingly nicknamed Pancham , are alive even today. Lata added that she’s sure that his music will continue to spread magic in the next hundred years too.

The 83-year-old singer also shared the link to the song ‘Tere liye palkon ki’ from the 1981 film Harjaee .

Burman was married to Ms. Mangeshkar’s younger sister, singer Asha Bhonsle. Together, they had three children Varsha Bhosle, Hemant Bhosle and Anand Bhosle. Varsha and Hemant passed away in recent years. — IANS
title: Lata Mangeshkar pays tribute to R.D. Burman
